item.title: Winter Practice
item.description: Hi everyone, Hope everyone’s final season went well! We’ll be holding our first practice session for the ICPC online soon. We’re planning on having a 5-hour session about every 10 days, and our first practice contest will be at 2:00pm EST this Wednesday the 28th.

item.title: Contests
item.description: To see more contests from different platforms, please visit CLIST.

item.title: About ICPC
item.description: International Colligiate Programming Contest is held every year. We usually have a few teams going to the Greater New York Region(GNYR) contests. The top teams from the regionals advance to the North America Championship(NAC) and finally to the World Finals. Keep an eye out for announcements about the regional contests if you are interested in becoming part of the next NYU championship team! The North America Qualifier(NAQ) is an online contests leading to the ICPC regional contests (see above for more details about ICPC).

item.title: About Us
item.description: The ProgTeam is a place for students interested in solving problems to practice their skills, learn new ones and share their knowledge and passion with others. Whether you are preparing for technical interviews, practicing for programming contests, or solve problems for fun, you should find like-minded students in ProgTeam. Discord Server: We have a Discord Server for discussions. Click on the link to join us! Kattis: We use Kattis as our current practice platform.
